activities: Personnel information for EU companies may be stored on Global Alert Link (GAL) systems for use during emergencies or crises. When the customer determines an emergency situation has occurred, this information can be readily disseminated to preapproved parties thus aiding the client with crisis management. The data is either collected from a secured automated feed or provided by EU employers at the discretion of their employees. Clients are solely responsible for obtaining permission from their employees before sending personnel data to GAL.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Customer organizational data as well as customer employee contact data.
privacyprograms: GAL is not a member of any privacy programs at this time
recoursemech: Independent Recourse Mechanism – GAL is subject to compliance with EU Data Protection Authorities (DPAs) concerning personnel data from EU organizations. A panel of DPAs will make recourse decisions regarding complaints from the EU.  For Switzerland, we will use the Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC)
